intro: Humboltia gracillima, commonly known as the slender corymbia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in corymbs, giving it its common name. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly aromatic scent. Humboltia gracillima is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
